title: Book by Fusion GPS founders coming out next month
text:
The co-founders of a political research firm behind allegations about President Donald Trump's ties to Russia have a book coming out next month.

Random House announced Monday that 'Crime in Progress: Inside the Steele Dossier and the Fusion GPS Investigation of Donald Trump' will be published 26 November.

The book was co-written by Fusion GPS founders Glenn Simpson and Peter Fritsch.

Glenn Simpson, co-founder of Fusion GPS, can be seen arriving before a closed House Intelligence Committee hearing on Capitol Hill in Washington. He and Peter Fritsch are releasing a 'never-before-told inside story' at the end of November into Trump's relationship with Russia. An announcement made by publishers Random House yesterday said that the 'never-before-told inside story' would be released on the 26 November

Random House is calling the book a 'never-before-told inside story.' It will be based around Trump and Russia and the investigation into whether his campaign colluded with them during the 2016 election.

Simpson and Fritsch started investigating Trump's ties to Moscow in Summer 2015 through their Washington-based political investigations company.

Fusion GPS helped compile the so-called Steele Dossier, by former British spy Christopher Steele, who in his findings contended that the Russian government held compromising information on Trump.

Former Mi6 spy Christopher Steele said that he had information incriminating Trump in his relationship to the Kremlin

That compromising information said that Moscow had Trump in its pocket and had put resources into assisting the president to launch a major operation to defeat Hilary Clinton.

They also reported that the Kremlin had compromising information about him and had material relating to him buying prostitutes.

In his tweets, the president has attacked the dossier as 'FAKE.'

The company has rejected claims that they are out to get the president. The Fusion GPS website says they 'conduct[s] open-source investigations and provide[s] research and strategic advice for businesses, law firms and investors.'

They also aid in 'political inquiries, such as opposition research.'
description: The co-founders of an investigations firm behind allegations about President Trump's ties to Russia have a book out next month called 'Crime in Progress' which will be published by Penguin.
